GT.content: question of the “come” of the “come back” will invaginate, efface, all borders, will redouble endlessly ambivalence of gift as good or bad, gift or poison (Gift-gift)
GT.linkedContent: question of the “come” of the “come back” will invaginate, efface, all borders, will redouble endlessly ambivalence of gift as good or bad, gift or poison (Gift-gift)

GT.content: social function of beggar, madman: “the pocket of an indispensable internal exclusion,” like structure of pharmakos, incorporation w/out introjection (assimilation), an identity by exclusion, keeps outside w/in, l’exception faite (fors) d’une clôture ou d’un clivage intérieur
GT.linkedContent: social function of beggar, madman: “the pocket of an indispensable internal exclusion,” like structure of pharmakos, incorporation w/out introjection (assimilation), an identity by exclusion, keeps outside w/in, l’exception faite (fors) d’une clôture ou d’un clivage intérieur

LOBL.content: possible from “first trace” on, which is why there is no first trace: the outside opens a pocket [cf. F p. xix crypt: pocket of resistance]
LOBL.linkedContent: possible from “first trace” on, which is why there is no first trace: the outside opens a pocket [cf. F p. xix crypt: pocket of resistance]

LOBL.content: “crisscross double invagination,” chiasma btwn double invagination possible because of iterability of the mark (folds coming from both borders)
LOBL.linkedContent: “crisscross double invagination,” chiasma btwn double invagination possible because of iterability of the mark (folds coming from both borders)

LOBL.content: double invagination constitutes story of stories, narrative of deconstruction in deconstruction: apparently outer edge of a clôture, makes no sign beyond itself, toward tout autre, w/out becoming dual, being “represented,” refolded, re-marked w/in the clôture > what the structure produces as an effect of interiority, this structure-effect is being deconstructed
LOBL.linkedContent: double invagination constitutes story of stories, narrative of deconstruction in deconstruction: apparently outer edge of a clôture, makes no sign beyond itself, toward tout autre, w/out becoming dual, being “represented,” refolded, re-marked w/in the clôture > what the structure produces as an effect of interiority, this structure-effect is being deconstructed

LOBL.content: structure of invagination exposes precariousness of effects of “genre,” “mode, “corpus,” all historical fictions that certify its carte d’identité
LOBL.linkedContent: structure of invagination exposes precariousness of effects of “genre,” “mode, “corpus,” all historical fictions that certify its carte d’identité

LOBL.content: infinite violence [of what’s strictly called] “double bind,” double invagination, double obligation, double demand > sans arrêt and arrêt de mort, no reconciliation
LOBL.linkedContent: infinite violence [of what’s strictly called] “double bind,” double invagination, double obligation, double demand > sans arrêt and arrêt de mort, no reconciliation

LOBL.content: all interdictions of pas, its double bind and invagination, make it possible to read the unreadability of impossible event, (the after-life of resurrection) of this “news”
LOBL.linkedContent: all interdictions of pas, its double bind and invagination, make it possible to read the unreadability of impossible event, (the after-life of resurrection) of this “news”

LOBL.content: no paradigmatic text, only cryptic haunting from mark to mark, no piece, no metonymy, no integral corpus, thus no fetishism
LOBL.linkedContent: no paradigmatic text, only cryptic haunting from mark to mark, no piece, no metonymy, no integral corpus, thus no fetishism

LOBL.content: double invagination, through labor of translation, can be brought to bear on gaine in Glas
LOBL.linkedContent: double invagination, through labor of translation, can be brought to bear on gaine in Glas

LOBL.content: Blanchot’s narrative held together w/ invisible hinge, double inner edge (bord)
LOBL.linkedContent: Blanchot’s narrative held together w/ invisible hinge, double inner edge (bord)

LOBL.content: “come”: single word, yet intertwined in series, inscribes its own effacement in middle of and on invaginated boundaries of récit, of these crypts, death or bridal chambers, hymen brings alliance & separation [after theft of key]
LOBL.linkedContent: “come”: single word, yet intertwined in series, inscribes its own effacement in middle of and on invaginated boundaries of récit, of these crypts, death or bridal chambers, hymen brings alliance & separation [after theft of key]

POR.content: invagination of internal pocket: empty place for chance (for great and precious freedom of play) [re: time of reflection on university]
POR.linkedContent: invagination of internal pocket: empty place for chance (for great and precious freedom of play) [re: time of reflection on university]

POOF.content: every instant begins at the end, address carries in its readability the signature of the addressee: it withdraws from space by penetrating it
POOF.linkedContent: every instant begins at the end, address carries in its readability the signature of the addressee: it withdraws from space by penetrating it

DS.content: no total/proper meaning because blank folds over (se plie), dès que le blanc (est) blanc, (se) blanchit, as soon as there’s a mark, there’s a re-mark, no blank w/ capital B, no theology of Text > le pli (se) plie: son sens s’espace d’une double marque, au creux de laquelle un blanc se plie
DS.linkedContent: no total/proper meaning because blank folds over (se plie), dès que le blanc (est) blanc, (se) blanchit, as soon as there’s a mark, there’s a re-mark, no blank w/ capital B, no theology of Text > le pli (se) plie: son sens s’espace d’une double marque, au creux de laquelle un blanc se plie

P.content: Derrida exposes footnotes, parentheses and imported frames (something of understanding in judgment) as invagination (pocket in main text) [Kant forced things, not Derrida?]
P.linkedContent: Derrida exposes footnotes, parentheses and imported frames (something of understanding in judgment) as invagination (pocket in main text) [Kant forced things, not Derrida?]

ROP.content: double bind at work on examples of all undecidable figures (hymen, pharmakon…), carry predicates incompatible btwn themselves, in their very btwn, interlacing, sumplukē, chiasmatic invagination > but each one, in its sumplukē, makes up a single trace [?]
ROP.linkedContent: double bind at work on examples of all undecidable figures (hymen, pharmakon…), carry predicates incompatible btwn themselves, in their very btwn, interlacing, sumplukē, chiasmatic invagination > but each one, in its sumplukē, makes up a single trace [?]

ROP.content: what happens when you apply chiasmatic invagination of borders to analysis? to its phallogocentrism (mastery)? > can psychoanalysis belong to anyone, anymore?
ROP.linkedContent: what happens when you apply chiasmatic invagination of borders to analysis? to its phallogocentrism (mastery)? > can psychoanalysis belong to anyone, anymore?

OTO.content: the umbilicus has you by the ear, the ear is “taking notes,” the master a mouth (ear, mouth: both invaginated, involuted orifices) > the umbilical cord of State (dead father, cold monster) education, like a leash, commands us to write—that’s uncanny
OTO.linkedContent: the umbilicus has you by the ear, the ear is “taking notes,” the master a mouth (ear, mouth: both invaginated, involuted orifices) > the umbilical cord of State (dead father, cold monster) education, like a leash, commands us to write—that’s uncanny

WAP.content: figure of fold, explicitation, complication, often imposes itself on us > not incompatible w/ circular band or invagination [re: right to teaching assumes knowledge/teaching of right][cf. 197n “chiasmatic invagination of borders”]
WAP.linkedContent: figure of fold, explicitation, complication, often imposes itself on us > not incompatible w/ circular band or invagination [re: right to teaching assumes knowledge/teaching of right][cf. 197n “chiasmatic invagination of borders”]

REST.content: for Heidegger, the picture is doubly useless, depicts, “shows,” being-products that’re out-of-service, w/out use-value > multiple edge(s) (bordures) detach being-product from subjective scope (portée subjective), simultaneously baiting (inducing/luring) reattachment of subjective scope
REST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, the picture is doubly useless, depicts, “shows,” being-products that’re out-of-service, w/out use-value > multiple edge(s) (bordures) detach being-product from subjective scope (portée subjective), simultaneously baiting (inducing/luring) reattachment of subjective scope

REST.content: edge (bordure) less simple when turned inside out [invaginated?], not simple at all w/ the lace & the hemmed holes (trous bordés), the eyelets comme lieu de passage [figure of decapitation here too]
REST.linkedContent: edge (bordure) less simple when turned inside out [invaginated?], not simple at all w/ the lace & the hemmed holes (trous bordés), the eyelets comme lieu de passage [figure of decapitation here too]

RM.content: closure is not a circular limit (bordering homogenous field), but a more twisted (plus retorse) structure, another figure: “invaginated”
RM.linkedContent: closure is not a circular limit (bordering homogenous field), but a more twisted (plus retorse) structure, another figure: “invaginated”

RM.content: representation of a linear & circular closure surrounding a homogenous space is a self-representation of philosophy in its onto-encyclopedic logic
RM.linkedContent: representation of a linear & circular closure surrounding a homogenous space is a self-representation of philosophy in its onto-encyclopedic logic

RM.content: re-trait of metaphor > gives rise to an abyssal generalization of metaphor > trait has internal multiplicity, la structure pliée-repliée d’un re-trait > opens out the borders or invaginates them
RM.linkedContent: re-trait of metaphor > gives rise to an abyssal generalization of metaphor > trait has internal multiplicity, la structure pliée-repliée d’un re-trait > opens out the borders or invaginates them

RM.content: withdrawal of Being donne lieu to metaphysics, ontotheology, producing concept of metaphor, producing/calling itself in a quasi-metaphorical manner
RM.linkedContent: withdrawal of Being donne lieu to metaphysics, ontotheology, producing concept of metaphor, producing/calling itself in a quasi-metaphorical manner

RM.content: word re-trait designates quasi-catachrestic violence, abuse I impose on language, hopefully justified by necessity of good, economic formalization
RM.linkedContent: word re-trait designates quasi-catachrestic violence, abuse I impose on language, hopefully justified by necessity of good, economic formalization

HST.content: border btwn ethical/political no longer insured: the 3rd (le tiers) gives birth to justice & finally state, 3rd announces himself in duel of the face-to-face, & the face: the beyond the state (condition of ethics) had to produce itself in the state
HST.linkedContent: border btwn ethical/political no longer insured: the 3rd (le tiers) gives birth to justice & finally state, 3rd announces himself in duel of the face-to-face, & the face: the beyond the state (condition of ethics) had to produce itself in the state

HST.content: this is a topological invagination: “outside produce[s] an enclave in the inside of the inside”
HST.linkedContent: this is a topological invagination: “outside produce[s] an enclave in the inside of the inside”

AD.content: Levinas’ “beyond-in (au-delà-dans)” of State of David [?], a sort of enclave inside and outside of itself, participates in politics while going beyond it > [deconstructive invagination]
AD.linkedContent: Levinas’ “beyond-in (au-delà-dans)” of State of David [?], a sort of enclave inside and outside of itself, participates in politics while going beyond it > [deconstructive invagination]

AD.content: transcendence in immanence, the door as the bearing (porte que porte)
AD.linkedContent: transcendence in immanence, the door as the bearing (porte que porte)

LG.content: trait that marks membership (l’appartenance) divides > boundary (bordure) of set comes to form by invagination—an internal pocket larger than the whole
LG.linkedContent: trait that marks membership (l’appartenance) divides > boundary (bordure) of set comes to form by invagination—an internal pocket larger than the whole

LG.content: consequences of this division & overflowing (débordement) as singular as they are limitless (qu’illimitables)
LG.linkedContent: consequences of this division & overflowing (débordement) as singular as they are limitless (qu’illimitables)

LG.content: edge (bord), borderline (ligne de bordure), overflowing (débordement) do not arise w/out a fold—which figure of folding? [the answer: double chiasmatic invagination]
LG.linkedContent: edge (bord), borderline (ligne de bordure), overflowing (débordement) do not arise w/out a fold—which figure of folding? [the answer: double chiasmatic invagination]

LG.content: in Blanchot’s La folie du jour, one reads (sees w/out seeing) the crumbling (effondrement) of the upper edge, initial edge, the one regulated by common law [as first line] > forms a pocket inside corpus, invagination: trait of first line, borderline, splits while remaining the same—traverses the corpus it bounds
LG.linkedContent: in Blanchot’s La folie du jour, one reads (sees w/out seeing) the crumbling (effondrement) of the upper edge, initial edge, the one regulated by common law [as first line] > forms a pocket inside corpus, invagination: trait of first line, borderline, splits while remaining the same—traverses the corpus it bounds

LG.content: there is only content w/out edge, w/out boundary, w/out frame, there is only edge w/out content: interminable inocclusive invagination (inenarrable, unarrestable, insatiable) > terrible for those who require order in the name of the law
LG.linkedContent: there is only content w/out edge, w/out boundary, w/out frame, there is only edge w/out content: interminable inocclusive invagination (inenarrable, unarrestable, insatiable) > terrible for those who require order in the name of the law

LG.content: a lower edge of invagination intersects invagination of upper edge: trait splits again into an internal & external edge
LG.linkedContent: a lower edge of invagination intersects invagination of upper edge: trait splits again into an internal & external edge

LG.content: une autre bouche ou une autre boucle invaginante—double chiasmatic invagination of edges
LG.linkedContent: une autre bouche ou une autre boucle invaginante—double chiasmatic invagination of edges

LG.content: [all this due to Blanchot’s layering play w/ récit (recite, story, true account)] the other enunciates a decision: tears the toile (canvas, web) of a text as it envelops itself indefinitely in itself
LG.linkedContent: [all this due to Blanchot’s layering play w/ récit (recite, story, true account)] the other enunciates a decision: tears the toile (canvas, web) of a text as it envelops itself indefinitely in itself

LG.content: récit of a récit w/out récit, whose visible space is but some border of itself w/out “self”: framing edge w/out content, w/out modal or generic boundaries: law of this textual event
LG.linkedContent: récit of a récit w/out récit, whose visible space is but some border of itself w/out “self”: framing edge w/out content, w/out modal or generic boundaries: law of this textual event

LG.content: double chiasmatic invagination of edges excludes pure form, question of literary genre is not a formal one: covers motif of law in general of generation in the natural and symbolic sense
LG.linkedContent: double chiasmatic invagination of edges excludes pure form, question of literary genre is not a formal one: covers motif of law in general of generation in the natural and symbolic sense

EU.content: Kant’s strict separation of knowledge (truth) & power (action) distinguishes sets in excess of themselves, covering the whole of which they’re supposed to be only a part > whole forms poche invaginée in every part or subset (sous-ensemble): intestine division, folding partition inside space
EU.linkedContent: Kant’s strict separation of knowledge (truth) & power (action) distinguishes sets in excess of themselves, covering the whole of which they’re supposed to be only a part > whole forms poche invaginée in every part or subset (sous-ensemble): intestine division, folding partition inside space

EU.content: double keeping of memory & chance (invagination of inside pocket); truth, Wahrheit, what keeps, calls upon [us] to watch faithfully, on coat of arms of American universities
EU.linkedContent: double keeping of memory & chance (invagination of inside pocket); truth, Wahrheit, what keeps, calls upon [us] to watch faithfully, on coat of arms of American universities

EU.content: provocation to think brings together in same instant desire for memory & exposure to future
EU.linkedContent: provocation to think brings together in same instant desire for memory & exposure to future

SPEC.content: resolution, solution [of Freud’s argument?]: band closer, mount tension until released [these are Freud’s schemas] > relating what Freud says to what he does (writing’s démarche, its performance), interlacings can no longer be undone, can’t be closed or opened—trait divided [see p. 391n double chiasmatic invagination of borders]: there can be no accounting, reckoning
SPEC.linkedContent: resolution, solution [of Freud’s argument?]: band closer, mount tension until released [these are Freud’s schemas] > relating what Freud says to what he does (writing’s démarche, its performance), interlacings can no longer be undone, can’t be closed or opened—trait divided [see p. 391n double chiasmatic invagination of borders]: there can be no accounting, reckoning

CHOR.content: “hymen,” “invagination,” part of Derrida’s attempt to re-sexualize philosophical/theoretical discourse, but these terms no longer simply designate figures of feminine body: what remains undecidable concerns [but not only] line of cleavage btwn 2 sexes
CHOR.linkedContent: “hymen,” “invagination,” part of Derrida’s attempt to re-sexualize philosophical/theoretical discourse, but these terms no longer simply designate figures of feminine body: what remains undecidable concerns [but not only] line of cleavage btwn 2 sexes

CHOR.content: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)
CHOR.linkedContent: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)

CHOR.content: invagination is always taken w/in syntax of expression “double chiasmatic invagination of borders,” doubly folded, redoubled, inversed: can we still recognize “representation of woman” in this movement?
CHOR.linkedContent: invagination is always taken w/in syntax of expression “double chiasmatic invagination of borders,” doubly folded, redoubled, inversed: can we still recognize “representation of woman” in this movement?

CHOR.content: questions of representation [of women] always too old & as yet to be born, overloaded w/ hieroglyphs & still as virgin as origin, like early morning in East
CHOR.linkedContent: questions of representation [of women] always too old & as yet to be born, overloaded w/ hieroglyphs & still as virgin as origin, like early morning in East
